channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache HTTP Server
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache HTTP Server

item.title: CVE-2019-17567|2024-08-05T01:40:15.824Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.6 to 2.4.46 mod_proxy_wstunnel configured on an URL that is not necessarily Upgraded by the origin server was tunneling the whole connection regardless, thus allowing for subsequent requests on the same connection to pass through with no HTTP validation, authentication or authorization possibly configured.

item.title: CVE-2018-1312|2024-08-05T03:59:37.841Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: In Apache httpd 2.2.0 to 2.4.29, when generating an HTTP Digest authentication challenge, the nonce sent to prevent reply attacks was not correctly generated using a pseudo-random seed. In a cluster of servers using a common Digest authentication configuration, HTTP requests could be replayed across servers by an attacker without detection.

item.title: CVE-2018-1302|2024-08-05T03:59:37.835Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: When an HTTP/2 stream was destroyed after being handled, the Apache HTTP Server prior to version 2.4.30 could have written a NULL pointer potentially to an already freed memory. The memory pools maintained by the server make this vulnerability hard to trigger in usual configurations, the reporter and the team could not reproduce it outside debug builds, so it is classified as low risk.

item.title: CVE-2018-1283|2024-08-05T03:59:37.277Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: In Apache httpd 2.4.0 to 2.4.29, when mod_session is configured to forward its session data to CGI applications (SessionEnv on, not the default), a remote user may influence their content by using a "Session" header. This comes from the "HTTP_SESSION" variable name used by mod_session to forward its data to CGIs, since the prefix "HTTP_" is also used by the Apache HTTP Server to pass HTTP header fields, per CGI specifications.

item.title: CVE-2018-1301|2024-08-05T03:59:37.954Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: A specially crafted request could have crashed the Apache HTTP Server prior to version 2.4.30, due to an out of bound access after a size limit is reached by reading the HTTP header. This vulnerability is considered very hard if not impossible to trigger in non-debug mode (both log and build level), so it is classified as low risk for common server usage.

item.title: CVE-2018-1333|2024-08-05T03:59:38.259Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: By specially crafting HTTP/2 requests, workers would be allocated 60 seconds longer than necessary, leading to worker exhaustion and a denial of service. Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.34 (Affected 2.4.18-2.4.30,2.4.33).

item.title: CVE-2018-1303|2024-08-05T03:59:38.124Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: A specially crafted HTTP request header could have crashed the Apache HTTP Server prior to version 2.4.30 due to an out of bound read while preparing data to be cached in shared memory. It could be used as a Denial of Service attack against users of mod_cache_socache. The vulnerability is considered as low risk since mod_cache_socache is not widely used, mod_cache_disk is not concerned by this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-40725|2024-08-02T04:33:11.879Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
A partial fix for CVE-2024-39884 in the core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.61 ignores some use of the legacy content-type based configuration of handlers. "AddType" and similar configuration, under some circumstances where files are requested indirectly, result in source code disclosure of local content. For example, PHP scripts may be served instead of interpreted.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.62, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38473|2024-08-02T04:12:24.848Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Encoding problem in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows request URLs with incorrect encoding to be sent to backend services, potentially bypassing authentication via crafted requests. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-39573|2024-08-02T04:26:15.994Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Potential SSRF in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to cause unsafe RewriteRules to unexpectedly setup URL's to be handled by mod_proxy. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38474|2024-08-02T04:12:24.794Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Substitution encoding issue in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows attacker to execute scripts in directories permitted by the configuration but not directly reachable by any URL or source disclosure of scripts meant to only to be executed as CGI.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.
Some RewriteRules that capture and substitute unsafely will now fail unless rewrite flag "UnsafeAllow3F" is specified.

item.title: CVE-2024-38476|2024-08-02T04:12:25.173Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Vulnerability in core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier are vulnerably to information disclosure, SSRF or local script execution via backend applications whose response headers are malicious or exploitable.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38477|2024-08-02T04:12:25.679Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: null pointer dereference in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to crash the server via a malicious request. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-39884|2024-08-02T04:33:11.167Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
A regression in the core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.60 ignores some use of the legacy content-type based configuration of handlers. "AddType" and similar configuration, under some circumstances where files are requested indirectly, result in source code disclosure of local content. For example, PHP scripts may be served instead of interpreted.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.61, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38472|2024-08-02T04:12:24.653Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests or content Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60 which fixes this issue. Note: Existing configurations that access UNC paths will have to configure new directive "UNCList" to allow access during request processing.

item.title: CVE-2024-40898|2024-08-02T04:39:54.851Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context, allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.62 which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-08-02T04:12:25.017Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.
Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the substitution are affected. Some unsafe RewiteRules will be broken by this change and the rewrite flag "UnsafePrefixStat" can be used to opt back in once ensuring the substitution is appropriately constrained.

item.title: CVE-2024-27316|2024-08-02T00:34:51.356Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

item.title: CVE-2024-38475|2024-07-31T07:50:15.647Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure.

item.description: HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

item.title: CVE-2023-38709|2024-04-04T19:19:35.467Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
Faulty input validation in the core of Apache allows malicious or exploitable backend/content generators to split HTTP responses.
This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: through 2.4.58.

item.title: CVE-2024-27316|2024-04-04T19:21:41.984Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

item.title: CVE-2024-24795|2024-04-04T19:20:48.803Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description:
HTTP Response splitting in multiple modules in Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker that can inject malicious response headers into backend applications to cause an HTTP desynchronization attack.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.59, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38473|2024-07-01T18:14:21.520Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Encoding problem in mod_proxy in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows request URLs with incorrect encoding to be sent to backend services, potentially bypassing authentication via crafted requests. item.title: CVE-2024-36387|2024-07-01T18:10:25.512Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20http%20server
item.description: Serving WebSocket protocol upgrades over a HTTP/2 connection could result in a Null Pointer dereference, leading to a crash of the server process, degrading performance.
